AI Beginner Documentation¶

Welcome to the AI Beginner project documentation! This project involves a Tic-Tac-Toe game AI that learns through experience using Reinforcement Learning (RL). The goal of this AI is to learn optimal strategies by playing games and refining its decisions over time. The project is written in Python and is designed to help beginners understand the basics of AI and reinforcement learning.

Installation¶

To set up this project on your local machine, follow the steps below:

  1. Clone the repository: ```bash git clone https://github.com/yourusername/AI-Beginner.git cd AI-Beginner

  2. Set up the virtual environment: To create a virtual environment, run: ```bash python -m venv venv Activate the virtual environment: On Windows, run: .venvScriptsActivate If you encounter an issue with scripts being disabled, use the following command in PowerShell: Set-ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Scope CurrentUser Install dependencies: After activating the virtual environment, install the required Python libraries using pip install -r requirements.txt

Usage To run the Tic-Tac-Toe AI, activate the virtual environment and start the game script. The AI will begin learning through its own experiences in playing the game.

Contributing To contribute to this project, please fork the repository, make your changes, and submit a pull request. We appreciate your contributions!

API Reference For detailed API documentation, please refer to the source code and functions in the project files.

With this, your installation steps are complete, followed by usage instructions, contributing guidelines, and the inclusion of the API reference section for further documentation. This should cover the essentials for someone setting up the project!
